Package frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems

Class GyroSwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
      • frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems.SwerveDrive
        • frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems.GyroSwerveDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoSwerveDrive
    public abstract class GyroSwerveDrive
extends SwerveDrive
    Expands on the SwerveDrive for field relative control, using a gyro.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GyroSwerveDrive

        public GyroSwerveDrive​(SwerveWheel flWheel,
                       SwerveWheel frWheel,
                       SwerveWheel rlWheel,
                       SwerveWheel rrWheel,
                       double widthToHeightRatio)
        Creates a new GyroSwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels.
        Parameters:
        flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        widthToHeightRatio - The ratio from the track to the wheelbase (the distance between the centers of the front or back wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the left or right wheels).

    • Method Detail

      • fieldRelativeInputDrive

        public void fieldRelativeInputDrive​(double strafeX,
                                    double strafeY,
                                    double steering,
                                    boolean useInputCurves)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given strafing and steering inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +y is forwards and +x is to the right. Strafing is field relative, not robot relative.
        Parameters:
        strafeX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        strafeY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        steering - The steering speed, where a positive value steers clockwise from a top-down point of view
        useInputCurves - Whether or not to treat strafeX, strafeY, and steering as UI inputs (i.e. whether or not to apply the deadband set by SwerveDrive.setDeadband(double) to these values, and whether or not to apply other input curves). true means the deadband and curves will be applied.
        See Also:
        SwerveDrive.inputDrive(double, double, double, boolean), SwerveDrive.steerAndDriveAll(double, double), SwerveDrive.applyInputCurves(double)

      • getGyroAngle

        public abstract double getGyroAngle()
        Gets the gyro yaw angle on the range [0, 360) degrees.
        Returns:
        The gyro yaw angle.

      • resetGyro

        public abstract void resetGyro()
        Resets the gyro to a yaw angle of 0. It is recommended that this be called when this GyroSwerveDrive object is first instantiated, so the robot should be facing in the (field relative) forward direction when this class is instantiated in order to have an accurate fieldRelativeInputDrive(double, double, double, boolean).
